content: a yarn over and pulling the loop back through work 2 2 5 3 3 3 5 centimetres of ribbing back and forth in knit one purl one remember that the first and last stitch should be edge stitches the final row should be from the wrong side 2 © earthernal 2025 this pattern is for personal use only and may not be shared redistributed or copied items made from this pattern may not be produced for sale bind off in ribbing on the next row work all stitches as if continuing the ribbing each time you have two stitches on the right needle lift the back one over the front and off the needle so only one stitch remains when only one stitch remains pull the yarn through it cords the ties shown in the picture are finger crocheted with double yarn if you only have one skein you can pull out the other end from the centre of the ball and hold the yarn double finger crocheting is done by pulling the yarn through the loop with your thumb and forefinger tightening it to form a new loop and repeating until the desired length is reached make the ties the same length on both sides approximately eighteen to twenty-two centimetres or your preferred length ties the ties shown in the picture are finger crocheted with double yarn if you only have one skein you can pull out the other end from the centre of the ball and hold the yarn double finger crocheting is done by pulling the yarn through the loop with your thumb and forefinger tightening it to form a new loop and repeating until the desired length is reached make the ties the same length on both sides approximately 18-22 centimetres or your preferred length you could also make the ties using i-cord finishing touches sew the ties securely to the bonnet and weave in all loose ends 3 © earthernal 2025 this pattern is for personal use only and may not be shared redistributed or copied items made from this pattern may not be produced for sale
